009package Ch08_Binary_Regions;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
012
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.IJ;
016import ij.ImagePlus;
017import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
018import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
023import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
027import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
028import imagingbook.common.regions.Contour;
029import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
030import imagingbook.core.plugin.IjPluginName;
031import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
032
033/**
034 * <p>
035 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the class
036 * {@link RegionContourSegmentation} to perform both region labeling and contour
037 * tracing simultaneously. See Sec. 8.2.2 of [1] for additional details.
038 * Requires a binary image. Zero-value pixels are considered background, all
039 * other pixels are foreground. Display lookup tables (LUTs) are not considered.
040 * The resulting contours are displayed as a non-destructive vector overlay on
041 * the original image. Outer contours of single-pixel regions are marked by an
042 * "X". If no image is currently open, the plugin optionally loads a suitable
043 * sample image.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * This plugin also demonstrates the use of the {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter}
047 * (provided by the imagingbook library) which handles 0.5 pixel offsets for
048 * vector graphics transparently.
049 * </p>
050 * <p>
051 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
052 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
053 * </p>
054 * 
055 * @author WB
056 * @version 2020/12/20
057 * @version 2022/09/27 revised overlay generation
058 * 
059 * @see RegionContourSegmentation
060 */
061@IjPluginName("Region Contours Demo")
062public class Region_Contours_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
063        
064        /** Neighborhood type used for region segmentation (4- or 8-neighborhood). */
065        public static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N8;
066        
067        /** Stroke width used for drawing contours. */
068        public static double ContourStrokeWidth = 0.25;
069        /** Color used for drawing outer contours. */
070        public static BasicAwtColor OuterContourColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
071        /** Color used for drawing inner contours. */
072        public static BasicAwtColor InnerContourColor = BasicAwtColor.Green;
073        
074        /** Set true to list detected regions to the text console. */
075        public static boolean ListRegions = false;
076        
077        private ImagePlus im = null;
078        
079        /**
080         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
081         */
082        public Region_Contours_Demo() {
083                if (noCurrentImage()) {
084                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ToolsSmall);
085                }
086        }
087        
088        @Override
089        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
090                this.im = im;
091                return DOES_8G; 
092        }
093        
094        @Override
095        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
096                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
097                                IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
098                                return;
099                }
100                
101                if (!runDialog())
102                return;
103                
104                // Make sure we have a proper byte image:
105                ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor();
106                
107                // Create the region segmenter / contour tracer:
108                RegionContourSegmentation seg = new RegionContourSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood);
109                
110                // Get a list of detected regions (sorted by size):
111                List<BinaryRegion> regions = seg.getRegions(true);
112                if (regions.isEmpty()) {
113                        IJ.showMessage("No regions detected!");
114                        return;
115                }
116
117                // Draw outer and inner contours for each detected region:
118                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
119                ColoredStroke outerStroke = new ColoredStroke(ContourStrokeWidth, OuterContourColor.getColor());
120                ColoredStroke innerStroke = new ColoredStroke(ContourStrokeWidth, InnerContourColor.getColor());
121                
122                for (BinaryRegion r : seg.getRegions()) {
123                        Contour oc = r.getOuterContour();
124                        ola.addShape(oc.getPolygonPath(), outerStroke);
125                        for (Contour ic : r.getInnerContours()) {
126                                ola.addShape(ic.getPolygonPath(), innerStroke);
127                        }
128                }
129                
130                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
131                
132                // Optionally list regions to console:
133                if (ListRegions) {
134                        IJ.log("\nDetected regions: " + regions.size());
135                        for (BinaryRegion R : regions) {
136                                IJ.log(R.toString());
137                        }
138                }
139        }
140        
141        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
142        
143        private boolean runDialog() {
144                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Contours_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
145                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
146                gd.addEnumChoice("Outer contour color", OuterContourColor);
147                gd.addEnumChoice("Inner contour color", InnerContourColor);
148                gd.addNumericField("Stroke width", ContourStrokeWidth, 1);
149
150                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", ListRegions);
151                
152                gd.showDialog();
153                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
154                        return false;
155                }
156                
157                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
158                OuterContourColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
159                InnerContourColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
160                ContourStrokeWidth = gd.getNextNumber();
161                ListRegions  = gd.getNextBoolean();
162                return true;
163        }
164}
